intro: Ossaea heteronervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined ossaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound umbellate inflorescences. The leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive pattern of veins that contribute to its scientific name. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. This plant is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
